rights_of_access.subcategory: Right to Inspect and Copy Within Reasonable Time
rights_of_access.description: Every person has the right to inspect and copy any public record within a reasonable time of making the request. Agency must acknowledge receipt within 5 working days.
rights_of_access.conditions: Applies to every person; reasonable time standard; 5-day acknowledgment required
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Flexible reasonable time standard accommodates varying request complexity
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert: '1 M.R.S. § 408-A grants every person the right to inspect and copy public records within reasonable time. Please provide access to [records] and acknowledge within 5 working days.'

rights_of_access.description: Agency must acknowledge receipt within 5 working days, then provide good faith estimate of timeframe and costs, and make good faith effort to respond within estimated time.
rights_of_access.conditions: 5 working days to acknowledge; must provide timeframe and cost estimate; must make good faith effort to meet estimate
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Estimate-based system provides transparency about expected delays and costs
rights_of_access.request_tips: Follow up: '1 M.R.S. § 408-A requires acknowledgment within 5 working days and good faith timeline/cost estimate. Please provide estimate and commit to good faith efforts to meet it.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: First 2 Hours Free / 10¢ Per Page Cap
rights_of_access.description: First 2 hours of staff time are free. After 2 hours: up to $25/hour for search/retrieval. Maximum 10¢ per standard page. No per-page fee for electronic records.
rights_of_access.conditions: First 2 hours always free; $25/hour max after; 10¢/page cap; electronic records no per-page fee
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Generous 2-hour free threshold protects most requests; low fees keep costs minimal
rights_of_access.request_tips: Cite free time: '1 M.R.S. § 408-A provides first 2 hours of staff time free, then maximum $25/hour and 10¢/page. No per-page fees for electronic records. Please comply with fee limits.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: Written Denial with Specific Reason Within 5 Days
rights_of_access.description: If denied, agency must provide written notice within 5 working days stating specific reason for denial. Denial must cite legal authority.
rights_of_access.conditions: Written denial required; within 5 working days; must state specific reason and cite authority
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fast denial notice requirement; prevents indefinite delay tactics through non-response
rights_of_access.request_tips: Challenge delay: '1 M.R.S. § 408-A requires written denial within 5 working days if denying access. Please provide written denial with specific reasons or grant access.'

rights_of_access.description: Appeals must be made within 30 days of denial to Superior Court in county where request was made. Court may award attorney fees and costs to prevailing plaintiff.
rights_of_access.conditions: 30 days to appeal; Superior Court in county of request; attorney fees discretionary for prevailing plaintiff
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Strict 30-day deadline; fee provision makes enforcement financially viable
rights_of_access.request_tips: Warn: '1 M.R.S. § 409 permits Superior Court appeal within 30 days with potential attorney fee award. I am prepared to pursue this remedy if you continue withholding records unlawfully.'
